DUMDUMDUMDUMDUMDUMDUMDUM!

*mexican back of house
author: Dan B.

description: This place is incredible! I highly recommend taking friends or family to join around the table for a delicious, authentic, well presented meal. Absolutely superb!
author: Katie V.

description: A really winning little place, since it transitioned from Dum. We had kale chaat, butter chicken, shrimp curry, chicken biryani, green beans, and a plain naan. All were excellent and nicely presented in a modern setting, and the staff were extremely attentive. Our friends don't care for lamb, so we'll need to return to try a lamb dish or two and other chaat. In our view, surpasses 1 August, and other new "up-market" Indian places and we didn't feel like we were paying a surcharge for "attitude"... A great addition to the Mission.
author: Jim F.

description:
Omg. The food. I don't think I need to say more. These guys just opened so give them a break while they work out new location kinks. 

Wine selection while small is very good. Ordered the rose. Not too sweet and went well with the spices. 

Must order: 
- dahi puri. Pop an entire donut-shaped pastry in your mouth for the whole experience. 
- Samosa chaat

We also had the Lamb biryani and the Vegetable bowl. Both also very good. The lamb was tender and juicy. The bowl base is lentils; it was full of flavor and mildly spicy. 

The music was tasteful, not obnoxious pop radio noise. French hip hop was a nice touch. Though it depends on who is working. 

Note that it's street food. No courses. It's brought out when ready.
author: Kiai K.

description: Super yummy Hyderabadi food with a Californian twist! Highly recommend the lamb biryani and Kale chaat and try the Pear Lassi too great update on the boring staple of mango lassi.  The service is incredible too, the staff is just so super sweet
author: Nivliness S.

description: I enjoyed the food here however there were some dishes that I wish had a bit more taste.  There was a good selection of vegetarian options and I want to give it a try again soon.  I'll update my review after my second visit.
author: Kenji M.

description: An absolute must stop if you are in the neighborhood!  Incredible tastes of India with a nice modern twist. This is my 5th visit (dinner and brunch) and have to say this is the most enjoyable and tasty Indian food in SF. Combine that with the approachable atmosphere and personable chef, you can be sure of a truly authentic and fun experience.  Honestly, so tasty and fun for all meals!!!
author: C K.

description: Very expensive restaurant with low quality n low quantity food...better to choose next other restaurant...
author: Khagen O.

description: This is an Indian restaurant with a modern concept. My friend told me about this place. I finally tried it tonight. I was interested in the chicken biryani, kati roll, and paratha. I went with chicken biryani. My friend and I had the mango lassi. My friend had the veggie plate. Also, we shared the sprouts salad, which was okay. The mango lassi is kind of overpriced by 1 or 2 dollars at $5 for a smaller mason jar full of it. It was kind of warm, but drinkable. I liked the chicken biryani. This restaurant has a nice ambience located on 24th Street(and Folsom) in the Mission. I'm not dying to come back, but I'd try something else on the menu.
author: Denise C.

description:
We went to DUM for dinner, it was empty when we first arrived and we were seated quickly. We received the menu which was very small! We had no idea that DUM had been a food truck and just now had opened a restaurant. The menu is super small and does not offer the traditional curry that one would expect of an Indian restaurant. 
We wanted to try it out so we ordered the Chicken Kati Roll as well as an order of the Chicken Biryani.  

The Chicken Biryani is definitely large enough to share between two people and it was served with a small bowl of yogurt with puffs in it. The Biryani was on the drier side for me, I usually like a Biryani that is more seasoned and retains more moisture but this one was fairly dry so the yogurt was a good side with it. Not as seasoned and flavorful as homemade but not bad either. 

The Kati Roll was the better part of the meal. It was packed with meat and sauce and onions. It was flavorful and well seasoned. Definitely would recommend this! 

One thing that I didn't personally enjoy about the place was the waiters constantly coming up to the table. They would come around way too often. At one point I was pouring my boyfriend's beer from the bottle in to his glass and the waiter came over and gestured to take the bottle and do it himself. They definitely need to work on the waiting skills. 

Waiting staff and a small menu are definitely the cons of the place.
author: Shivani G.

description:
I saw their food truck first at Off the Grid but didn't get a chance to try it out until I came to the physical restaurant. The actual restaurant is a very casual spot. 

I got the samosas and the Kati roll. My friends got the lamb biryani and the chicken biryani. The biryani is definitely much better than the items I ordered. So the four stars is for the biryani, not the Kati roll and samosas.

The samosas were over-fried so the wrapping was too crunchy on the folded parts. The pieces of chicken in the Kati roll were way too big. Since they used the chicken breast, it didn't have much flavor in the middle which was a problem because the chunks were so large.

Would give a 3.5 star rating if I could.
author: Rica Z.

description: EXCELLENT! A spectacular flavor party in your mouth. We had the Samosa,Shrimp Curry,Tandori Fried Chicken,stuffed bread w/ garlic & cheese & Rice. Can't explain the unique spices & how good everything tasted. Off the typical SF path,in an eclectic area a few miles from the hum drum but a "must" eat at. We went during happy hour,a nice accident. All staff was kind. An overall fabulous experience!
author: Carmen B.

description:
Everything on the menu is awesome. The servers are warm and welcoming, the menu is simple. The chai is delicious. Their biryani is the most authentic in San Francisco!
I highly recommend the veggie paratha as well.
author: Deepa G.

description:
Fancy Indian food. We had three appetizers (pani poori, two vegetable parathas), one side of beans, and a plate of the fried tandoori chicken. The appetizers were enough food to fill the three of us. 

The chicken takes a bit longer to cook, but it is definitely worth the wait. Everything on the plate was delicious: chicken, sauce, Brussels sprouts and slaw. The plate contained enough food enough to feed a small army! We ended up taking some home and it even reheated well in the oven.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Delicious food I must say! The only reason I mark it  down is because of the portions of some of their dishes verses the cost. The chana  masala is a small dish  and the parathas are $8.00 a piece ....wow
Like I said, tasty but expensive.
author: Mia C.

description: The corn cheese paratha is a unique flavorful experience!
author: Sajal J.

description:
I guess I'll just add to the slew of 5 star reviews! 

So, this place is good. Like, really good. I live a stone's throw away from DUM Indian, and I am excited to add some variety to my takeout options (namely, burritos). Ain't nothing wrong with a burrito, but sometimes you need a Samosa and a good biryani. 

And it's a *great* biryani! Having enjoyed several years in London with a plethora of truly fantastic Indian in our neighborhood, I'm happy to say DUM really exceeded expectations! 

The menu is simple, and covers the tried and true winners (samosas, biryani, kati rolls) but also has some more innovative plays on the originals, like tandoori fried chicken, braised eggplant, and a lamb burger. The flavors were on point, and the service was great. 

I can't wait to head back!
author: Brittany B.

description:
came here for saturday brunch 
it was quiet but the food was very good

Gluten free fried chicken with a rice pancake - the chicken was OFF THE HOOK wonderful 
Gluten Free Rice pancake with chutney  - very good and flavorful (sorry I forgot what the actual brunch menu item was called)

decent proportions for brunch

**extra bonus points for an unexpected baby changing table in the unisex bathroom!

I heard they also do food trucks for weddings! great for GF brides and grooms!
author: Win H.

description: The papdi chaat was amazing! Great ambiance as well. Will definitely go back as the items on the menu looked interesting.
author: Nikita N.

description: Decently good Indian food. Nice service. Excellent beer selection. Music is way too loud. Only two specials, which never seem to change, week after week. Portions sizes are very hard to predict from the menu - sometimes too much or too little. Five stars for tastes and flavors that are off the charts, the best everywhere. Minus one star for not hitting things just right.
author: Eater S.

description:
Everything we had was really good. 
The crispy kale was so delicious!! 
Can't wait to try more things next time. 
A new neighborhood favorite for sure!
author: Ms. G.

description: Wow. This is exactly what SF needed in terms of a casual, healthy every day kind of Indian spot!
author: Chirag C.

description:
Let me start off by saying, AMAZING everything. From the greeting at the door to the good bye at the end of the night. I went on a spontaneous date with the hubby and we loved every bit of this place. It's small and quaint, just the way we like restaurants. I made a reservation online for 8:30 and we were seated at a cute table for 2 with a Reserved sign on the table. Both of use are Indian food fans so we couldn't decide on what to order. Good thing they had a chefs choice on the menu because it was well worth the choice to order the chefs choice. It's only $35 per person and well worth every penny.Our dinner included crisped kale with home made trail mix and yogurt sauce; a kebab sampler with the lamb t bone, pork rib and chicken marinated in a yogurt based marinade; lamb biriyani; chick peas in a curry sauce, and a rice pudding with golden raisins in it topped with a caramel and pistachio crackle. We had a mango lassi and chai tea as well, which were equally as delicious to our taste. 

Now for the service. Their service was (yet again) amazing. Everyone that works there is very welcoming and attentive to each person sitting at their tables. The chef came out personally to explain his dishes to us before we dove right in. If you like little holes in the wall and you like Indian food, definitely come here. You will not be disappointed. I was sad when I had to leave my chai half empty because I was so full. It was finished by my hubby though, so nothing went to waste.
author: Lauren B.

description: What an amazing food experience.  While I enjoy indian food this was the best I've had.  The sauce with their fried chicken meal was out of control.
author: Nick K.

description: If I could give a negative star I would. This place is awful the food is decent but the service is the worst by far service I have ever had.
author: Kollin L.

description:
Service very slow, whole place felt kind of dingy and dirty and very dim. The whole place would look better with more light. 

Curry and eggs were delicious, but meat was dry and rice was strangely crunchy and not in a good way.
author: Megan R.

description: Good Indian food. Could be a little spicy but well balanced otherwise. I like their unconventional combination of traditional chutneys with the dishes (chicken skewers with coconut chutney and biryani with Dahi Boondi).
author: Vijay K.

description: My friend and I had great Indian fusion brunch. We split the "green eggs", "pancake", Dahi Puri chaat, and each had a mango lassi. All of it was delicious. My favorite was the green eggs and mango lassi. The eggs were perfectly poached and the creamed spinach had an appropriate amount of spice to get those Indian flavors. The mango lassi and the right about of sourness from the yogurt and mango sweetness. Everyone should check this place out.
author: Brian M.

description: Great service and food. Ask for the fried Chicken. It was not crowded during lunch time and was really surprised, probably not well known. Small menu but really tasty and great Indian food.
author: J S.

description: The food here is good - but nothing to write home about. Why I give this place five stars, however, is solely because of their Dahi Puri - or "SPDP". I am a hardcore chaat fan and look for quality chaat everywhere I go. I have found the spot for San Francisco.
author: Ninad A.

description: This is the best indian food I've had in SF, hands down.  I had the lamb meat balls on their brunch menu.  It was freakin' delicious.  Highly recommended to those foodies looking for their next place to recommend to their friends....Pure awesomeness
author: Scott H.

description:
My favorite Indian gourmet food in SF now. Don't come here looking for the traditional Indian faire.  Dum is not your prototypical Indian food place - the menu is unique and the food is clean (not oily, and you can taste the vegetables)! Again, don't come here looking for a "cheap" dinner either. You pay for the quality of ingredients, presentation and for comfort. 

Only downside : Corkage fees is steep. But they do serve good wines.
author: Sai M.

description:
This place is truly fantastic. The location and look of the restaurant is super unassuming, so it's really the food that sets it apart. And dear god is it good.

* Lamb Biryani - HOLY CRAP. I never thought I was a biryani fan, but I want to live in a bowl of this. Forever. The big pieces of lamb in some part, and broken up in others, so you could make the perfect bite depending on how meaty you're feeling at the moment. It was flavored so well. I tried to be polite to my friends with whom I was sharing, but eventually i moved the bowl closer to me and just went to town. It comes with a chunky Raita that was wonderful on it's own!

* Kale Cakes: Light and crunchy and creamy and sexy. Yep, sexy. This was a nice light change from some of the heavier dishes.

* Dahi Puri - Indian Paradox (another fantastic indian street food restaurant in town) introduced me to this dish, and now I have to have it when I see it on a menu. Theirs was really delicious as well, and I loved the amount of spices and goodies on top. Great dish to share among friends.

* Lamb Keema Stuff bread - If this is what Pizza hut has been trying to make all along, they just need to stop. This stuffed bread is SO. TASTY. Loved the pickled onions veggies on the side. Really rounded this dish out.

* BroccoliI/Cauliflower/Amul Cheese Stuffed bread - Just as fantastic as the Lamb one. I think I may have liked this one better, but that may have just been because I was also eating Lamb Biryani with it.

* Shrimp Coconut Curry + Bread - I want a Costco sized vat of this to put on everything. It's crack curry. It has to be. The shrimp were big and tender and cooked perfectly. The most exciting combo was the toasted Hawaiian roll-like sweet bread on the side. I wanted to give the shrimp curry sandwich that was created a standing ovation.

* Vegetable Korma (special) - This was my least favorite, BUT it was very good. I just personally find Korma a bit too mild in general. I loved how the veggies were shopped smaller, sop you could get a medley in every bite.

I love you, DUM. Mean it.
author: Haley J.

description: I really like this place. The parathas are fantastic. I had a Kati roll and that was decent. Their chaats were great too. Good spot for lunch and really good service.
author: Hema P.

description:
Yummy Indian food served in a casual environment where the emphasis is on quality, taste and simplicity unlike the regular Indian joints that overwhelm you. 

If you are looking for a nice, casual place in the Mission district, to get some comfort food, look no further! 

Its a simple menu - they have Chaat starters  + skewers and a salad, plus main course which is either Kati rolls or Biryani (plus daily specials I think) and dessert.

Starters: I had the Samosa Chaat, which was freshy, cruchy and very tasty with just the right amount of spices and masala! The Dahi Puri (a puff/pastry w/ Yogurt, potatoes and spices) was a nice way to cool down after the samosa chaat. Both are highly recommended!

Main Course: I had the Paneer Kati roll, and a paratha! I loved the Kati roll had trouble finishing the paratha as the starters + Kati roll were very filling. 

I was too full to try the deserts! Next time. My friends had the chicken biryani and they loved it that they ordered a second serving!

They have a small wine + beer list which can be nicely paired w the Biryani and Kati rolls. 

Definitely a must try if you have a craving for simple, casual food in the Mission district. They are new, so if you can't locate them, they are right next door to the original Philz Coffee location which you cannot miss.

Two Thumbs up!
author: Balaji T.

description:
Just get here!!! Parking is a mess unless you wait and start at 5:45. Get a spot and then wait for the free meter to start. Back to this hidden gem cause it won't be for long. I was there on the 2nd day. Sat at the bar. Didn't know the menu. Asked Pam, server what to get. Was asked what i liked, told her and the Chef Rupam what ingredients work for me. They took it from there. OH BOYYYY! To much goodness here. Left with bag full of take away treats!!! 

Get here!!! Just let them bring it out. All good. I had about 7 different items.
author: Tommy F.

description:
Fun and inventive concept, but it's lacking the SOUL. 

I think the dishes are all creative but having grown up on Indian food and also having tried everything from the likes of hipster Indo-fusion (Juhu Beach Club, Dosa SF, Tigerlily, etc.) to get-yo-hands-dirty Shalimar and Pakwaan, the flavors here are just TOO mellow. 

Papri chaat didn't have the right cold and crispy feel, the chicken kathi roll was too dry, and the fried tandoori chicken was definitely juicy but its marinade really lacked the spicy zing. 

I think Dum has a lot going for it menu-wise and presentation-wise, they just need go HAM on the flavors / masala as any Indian food should.
author: Arushi S.

description: Very oily batura - which was more of a flat hard poori dripping in oil. Slow poor service. Paratha unexceptional. Chaat was the only solace
author: Abhilash R.

description: I keep coming back here for the Green Eggs dish on weekends.   Really like this place!
author: Jean A.

description:
1) Great wine list. The staff is willing to help you find the right glass. 

2) Try the Dahi Puri. It is sweet, savory, and perfect. 

3). The skewers. They are all good. But the pork belly is not to be missed.
author: Nathaniel H.

description:
I have to say I just loved our meal here.  The place isn't long open and the staff are so eager to please. It's so great to get good attentive service that feels genuine and not forced. We sat at the chefs counter so we could see all the dishes being made. We got Samosa Chaat,  Pork Kati Roll, Chicken skewers and Vegetable Paratha.  All were really tasty but our favourite was the Kati roll. Everything in the kitchen was spotlessly clean and chefs were very  accommodating. 

The chef was really attentive wanting to know what we thought about different dishes and even gave us 2 free Dahi Puri. 4 dishes and 2 beers for $40 which I felt was definitely worth it. We will be back. I hope this place is a huge success,  the food is far superior to the last restaurant in this location
author: Ger A.

description:
We ordered catering from Dum for a birthday cocktail party at our house. We arranged for them to deliver kati rolls (the paneer and the chicken, kind of like burrito-style items), and Make Your Own Chaat. The coordination of the catering was quite easy-- they were super-responsive by email in the days preceding the event.  The food was delivered on time for a small fee. It was organized (all the chaat sauces/condiments were labeled as to what they were AND which chaat they went with). 
The food was all delicious. Several people at the party asked where we got it. It was perfect cocktail party food-- tasty, but with enough bulk that it provided substance for those who were drinking. 
Honestly, it was perfect. So so good. I would no hesitate to order catering from them in the future.
author: Maia P.

description: Complimentary chai tea was nice. The place is very clean looking which is saying a lot for the area. The staff is super friendly and of course the food was good.
author: Tim T.

description:
I never write reviews on Yelp but I felt compelled to because this isn't only a great new addition to the neighborhood, but the staff seemed to genuinely care about our visit. I so appreciate that! 

We got the Tandoori Fried Chicken (Sunday special) and the vegetarian bowl of the day with paneer. The flavors were delicious and unlike anything I have ever had before. I really love their modern twist on classic Indian food. I can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu! 

The only down side was it took a little bit of time to receive our food, but the staff was very apologetic and honestly we didn't mind. I know they're a new restaurant and just working out some kinks.

I would recommend this place to anyone!
author: Chelsea D.

description:
What a nice surprise!... the flavors, the staff... I can't wait for my next time!!!...
My nose went crazy the moment I get in and when the food arrive it was just what I wanted...
Sometimes you don't need things to be fancy, you need them to be good!...
I will come back for sure, even follow their food truck!
author: Carlos A.

description: Must get the Crispy Kale Chaat!!! Texture, flavor, presentation on point!!! Best service I have had in weeks.
author: Xander S.

description:
DUM has stolen the hearts..or should I say stomachs of me and my husband! Fresh ingredients, truly soulful, reminded us of being back home. The chicken biriyani is delicious, without the feeling of heaviness when you leave. The paranthas are made to order. We loved the chaat.... Pretty authentic! 

Light, airy Indian food - sounds impossible, but DUM delivers just that! Kudos to Rupam and team for making this B&M a success! It's only been open a couple of weeks, and we have already been/ordered from there four times. Yeah...Best North Indian food in SF...hands down!
author: Shruthi N.

description: I had a paneer and a chicken kathi roll. I thought they were decent, probably one of the nicer ones I have had in SF. I asked for some extra hot sauce and the waiter said everything is inside the rolls. I thought that he should have still given me the hot sauce cause I needed more flavors.
author: Piyush K.

description: Dry biryani (is this a west coast thing? Seriously the biryanis out here are just dry rice).  Over salted.  Seems cute but nothing special.  Would stop by if in the hood but I'll take pakwan.
author: A A.

description:
Super tasty lamb biryani, meat was tender and flavorful with perfectly cooked rice, definitely a favorite for me. The lunch menu is great as well, their sandwiches are my go to for a take out bite during work.
Service is always friendly and fast, can't say enough good things about this place!
author: Diana V.

description: We have been coming to Dum for almost 2 years now and haven't found a better place in Bay Area for biryani. The staff is super friendly and it feels like we are having our meal cooked at home for us. Chef Rupam is very creative and puts a modern twist on even simplest of dishes like Beet Chaat and Brussel Chaat. We moved out of the city but keep coming back for the yummy lamb biryani!
author: Shreya A.

description: Had their dahi puri chat. Wasn't good , the curd was too thick and the sweet sauce was not good .
author: S R.

description:
I was so bummed after reading all the great reviews, as the biriani I had was so poor. The general experience was not so great either. 

A few more details for those who care:

They seem like great people, and I like supporting them. Have always had good food at the truck so may go back even though this meal was not enjoyable. 

We were seated and then forgotten, but that isn't a big deal. 

We only ordered one dish as it was late - lamb biriani - and we were very disappointed. It was so salty that I actually had a hard time eating the half portion I had. Also, the meat was very gamey and extremely dry... and a bit chalky. 

So it goes.
author: David B.

description:
I came across DUM on Yelp when my friend and I wanted Indian food in the Mission. The restaurant is nicely decorated, very modern and clean. There was a group that was already dining inside, and they looked like they were really enjoying the food, so my expectations were high.

After reading reviews, we both ordered the Lamb Biriyani. It was relatively good, but I feel like the spices were too mellow to what I'm used to. It wasn't that spicy, which was disappointing. Also the service was pretty sporadic. The waiter would either constantly be checking up on us or leave us for long periods. In the beginning, he approached our table about three times within a span of 10 mins from giving us our menus. After he gave us our food, he never came back until we asked for a refill of water. Overall, I was pretty disappointed, but I probably should try the food truck.
author: Erika P.

description: Great food.  I loved all of the interesting spices.  We went with a group of 5 and all shared the dishes.  Had the eggplant, fried chicken tandori, chicken kabobs, shrimp curry, bread stuffed with lamb, beet salad.  They were all amazing.  Best if you go with a group and share everything.
author: Paul A.

description:
The place is still finding its legs.  Waiter got a couple of items on the order wrong, and at billing time, he held onto  the iPad / bill like Gollum with the ring, so it was really to see what we were paying for. 
The food was ok - the chat was really good, the biryani was bland, so perhaps intended for someone other than a 3 green chilies a day spice addict like me. 
Nice atmosphere and everyone was friendly, so points for that.
author: Sandy C.

description: Service was great and really helpful. The Chicken biryani, pork loin and kale patties were all. absolutely delicious. Everything was cooked perfectly. The table next to me had lamb which looked even better. I'll be having that on my next visit.
author: Jay H.

description: We came upon DUM Indian Food, and found it to be a perfect ambience and the food was amazing. We were greeted in a warm, friendly environment,  and the service was just as warm and friendly (our server Nayan).  Valencia st. was.getting a little too sheik for or us, and it was a refreshing change of pace.
author: Brad J.

description: We had a beautiful dinner there with gentle caring service and amazing food!  The Scotch egg dish and the fried chicken were out of this world.  Beautiful and artistically presented, the food was wonderful.  A very pleasant surprise!
author: Christopher S.

description:
Our $18 "Shrimp Coconut Curry, Toasted Bread" tasted like it had a 1/2 pound of salt in it. We were drinking water the entire rest of the night! Was seriously ridiculous. The "Chicken biryani" was nice - chicken was tender.

Otherwise, the place was really just ok. Nice people. Decent ambiance.

Not gonna go back. So many better Indian food choices to choose from.
author: Jon B.

description: Best lamb Biryani I have yet. The carrot Halwa  was awesome. I'm going to keep an eye out for the food truck.
author: Grey H.

description:
Average Indian food.  My brother and I ordered chicken and lamb biryanis, and neither tasted all that hot and fresh. I sat at the counter and saw the chef just spoon the rice out of a hotel pan. The meat was overdone as expected, though the chickpea yogurt sauce helped ameliorate that.  The fried onions were a nice garnish.

The appetizers were ok.  We had an egg pancake filled with chicken, and little crisps filled with yogurt and chutneys.

I visited based on a very positive review from SF Gate that now seems entirely unwarranted.  A friend who runs a restaurant himself said he just bought a review from SF Gate to drum up business. Maybe the same thing happened here?

Anyway, I'd suggest Pakwan (Mission or Tenderloin), Shalimar or Dosa over this place. I won't be back.
author: Patrick M.

description: The food is good but the portions are too small given the price and the service was poor.  Despite it being almost empty in the restaurant, we had to flag down the waiter to even place our order, and then the food took a very long time to arrive.
author: Jeff D.

description: This is not traditional India food I'm accustomed too and if your looking for Nan this is not the place for you and found the place a little expensive. But it's a good modern place just not for me.
author: Matthew C.

description: Don't get the hype. The server was passive aggressive when we asked to take a recommended appetizer off the bill (one bite and no). He had to ask us 5-6 times and even when receiving the bill, we had to ask him to remove it again. The chicken biryani was tasty but not worth the hassle of dining in here. Chai was also underwhelming. Bummed that this neighborhood joint was a letdown.
author: Grace C.

description: Really terrific lamb biriyani. The lamb was soft and fragrant, the rice perfectly cooked, lots of flavor, not too salty (as biryanis can sometimes be), with some fresh herbs on top. The staff were all delightful, service was fast, and the atmosphere quite delightful!
author: Josh H.

description: It's not easy to prepare a good Indian meal. It is quite labor intensive and requires great skills to do it right! Head chef Rupam Bhagat has designed an amazing menu - from lip smacking chaats and rolls to delicious biryani!  The taste of every dish served here is extremely flavorful! Hands down 5 stars!
author: Roshni G.

description: LOVE this place. Had the samosas, which were fine, but the sauce made it. The kale cakes and Brussels were fantastic. Finished it off with the kafta kale balls. Love this stuff!!!!!
author: Courtney C.

description: Poor service. Every dish tasted like an over load of tamarind. The shrimp curry was 6 shrimp floating in a brown tamarind sauce that cost $18 with no vegetables or anything else to the dish. The bathrooms were filthy.
author: nana b.

description: We had the Dahi Puri the chicken Kati roll and the pork vindaloo sandwich. All three dishes were delicious. Prices are also very reasonable and service was great. We will come again.
author: Maya R.

description: Went there for my bday dinner with friends who live in the area. I was mildly impressed by the varieties and updates made to the traditional Indian meal. Everything from the beet salad to the tandoori fried chicken were amazing. It might seem like a hole in the wall but it absolutely deserves a visit. Or three.
author: Ali A.

description: Dum is off the hook! Ive already been here like a dozen times, and have tried mostly everything on the menu...GOOD STUFF!
author: Vivek N.

description: Just a terrific non pretentious Indian joint committed to quality, freshness and amazing value.  Definitely coming back!
author: Chris R.

description: Excellent, friendly service.  They have interesting takes on Indian cuisine, and everything I've tried has been excellent.
author: Leif C.

description: I had the lamb special tonight, which was a delicious balance between succulent spiced lamb patties and a delightful citrusy arugula salad. Paired with a glass of wine and a hot chai, it was the perfect small bite for a single person on the go. The waiter was extremely friendly and the chefs were very knowledgeable and accommodating. I will be coming back with friends!
author: Joyce O.

description: Empty, simple, good service and good food! Would go again and hope there would be more guests as I was the first and only there during late lunch. Nice and spicy!
author: Kikien B.

description: We had the eggplant dish and the butter chicken. The food is so clean and delicious. I felt compelled to write a review.
author: Bradford S.

description:
I visited DUM tonight and am an instant fan!  The food is delicious, ingredients are high quality and we left determined to return to try more of the dishes.  The staff is really friendly too - we were eyeing up an appetizer that we ultimately did not order and the chef sent it over to us anyway as a courtesy.

In terms of food, the samosas and the tandoori fried chicken were both excellent.  This place is definitely worth trying.  Prices are much more reasonable than DOSA
author: Benjamin R.

description:
Okay so strictly on basis on the food I had, not that great.  We tried the Samoa chat,  sev puri and kebabs. Kebabs were over cooked,  The Samoa chat was too dry. 
Now the ambience on the other had was really good.  Its not your typical indian restaurant..  It has a nice casual vibe which was appealing.
author: Anisha S.

description: Finally our neighborhood gets an Indian restaurant!! I was so tired of having to walk all the way to Aslam's rasoi everytime I had a hankering for something spicy. Coupled with he fact that Dum's lunch menu is simply the three best Indian "snacks." I'll definitely be frequenting this place for some time to come!
author: Aakash D.

description:
The food is simply awesome. I first had it from their truck some time ago and was ecstatic to discover this evening that they opened this restaurant. My wife and I were cautiously optimistic that the food from the restaurant would be as good as it was from their truck, and it certainly was. We absolutely loved it and look forward to going back to try other things on their menu. Also, the brunch menu on the chalkboard looked delicious, so we look forward to trying brunch here as well.

We are going to tell everyone we know about this place. I salute the owners for being so successful with their food truck that they have been able to open a restaurant.
author: Mick C.

description: Good food and great staff! really good addition to the mission! I will be back for sure:)
author: Alessandra C.

description: This is my go-to place for kati rolls in SF! Get the paneer!
author: Mon M.

description:
We started with the cauliflower broccoli stuffed bread.  We thought it was a bit salty but it was cooked to the perfect crispness on the outside and soft on the inside.

The fried chicken was to die for.  Perfectly cooked, juicy and the sauce for you to dip as much or as little as you please was full of flavour and they gave ample amounts.  The portion is an excellent portion size. 

We had chicken skewer which was an excellent portion and super juicy.  The lamb portion was small and I found the lamb cakes to have lost the lamb texture. 

The chicken briyani was delicious as well.  Chicken and rice was quite moist and flavourful.  

The vegetable briyani we found to have a bit of smoky flavour.  The veggies are frozen mixed vegetables.  That was a bit of a let down. 

The mango lassi was delicious.  Thick, creamy and smooth.  I almost wished it was frozen into a popsicle or made into an ice cream. 

We will be back!
author: Melissa Y.

description:
I'm the only one in here at 12:45pm on a Wednesday. Strange for a place with 4.5 stars. 

Anyway got chicken biryani which is very delicious. Great flavors, tender natural tasting chicken, seems like it's been marinated. Also apparently it comes out of some big vat, already made, so it's instant which is fine with me.
author: Jesse K.

description: Delicious, beautiful, fast, reasonable, great service! Better than the average Indian spot. Recommend the pork belly skewers, chicken skewers, chicken Kati roll, and samosa chaat.
author: Nathaniel K.

description: Giving it 5 stars because it deserves it at least for the Chicken Biryani which was on a different planet than anything I've had in SF. Hope they continue to work on the ambiance a bit... maybe some SomaFM "Suburbs of Goa" instead of the Trance/ambient music they had on. Maybe a tad pricy on some of the other dishes but the reality is we'll probably go get the Biryani at least a few times a month. Looking forward to trying the other creations.
author: Ryan M.

description: Great addition to the Mission! Truly soulful, beautifully presented Authentic Indian food. The chef makes his dishes with a lot of interest & care, you can see that from the bar area. Definitely coming back often & bringing friends too!!
author: Shilpa J.

description:
Visited here on Sunday afternoon for lunch not much of a crowd, seated quickly and ordered Dahi puri, with Shrimp Tandoori Kebab ( Sunday special) and the lamb biryani, everything was yummy and portions are enough for 2 people. Ambience is cozy. 
We will definitely visit again !
author: Vish E.

description:
Rice as soft as jasmine petals? Who cooks like that anymore?  Visit DUM and find out how the famous hard to cook Indian dish "biriyani" is actually supposed to taste.
DUM refers to a sealed earthenware crock of layered rice, meat and spices bakedlong and slow over and yes, even UNDER hot coals. The process creates a famously tender and light and oil-free dish. 
They've got it!   Check it out.
author: Nan L.

description: I have eaten in many Indian restaurants and this is the best food I've ever had. Everything was presented beautifully and the recipes were so creative, right down to yhe amazing desserts...not your typical Indian food. This place ranks among the best restaurants in the city. I was at dinner with "foodies", one of whom was a professional chef. We all agreed.
author: Carol D.

description: Great food here. The Samosa Chaat was Delish and crispy and spicy. The Chicken Biryani is one of their specialties and did not disappoint. Try the Dahi Puri for a unique taste.
author: Mark N.

description: Ordered the lamb biryani ($15). The rice was dry and overcooked with some pieces being crunchy while the lamb was simply ok. The dish was not worth $15 IMO but maybe we just came on a bad day.
author: Monique S.

description:
I got takeout from DUM yesterday I was blown away by the overall quality and freshness of this Indian food.

We had chicken skewers, paneer skewers, chicken biryani samosas & a Kati roll. All were outstanding, specially the complementary sauces that added an extra layer of complexity to each dish.

Welcome to the neighborhood DUM! I hope you stay here a long time!
author: Tom C.

description:
this is pretty amazing. the biriyani, while not socking your face with spices (eg pakwan), is very elegant and flavorful. its when you want to get biriyani that isnt too overpowering, and allows you to taste and savor the spices. it is not hipster indian food either (eg curry up now)-- still quite authentic, true to the flavors, while also being very palatable to people who might not be familiar with the type of cuisine. 

and for those looking for a burrito replacement, their kati roll is 6 bux and maybe 1/2 the size of a burrito. its actually perfect for lunch that hits the spot, without making you too full. increible!

i am surprised at any of the nitpicky reviews by people (wait staff to attentive; a couple people insinuating that because the wait was non-existent that it was a demerit for the restaurant). yes the wait staff is very eager, and no there isnt a wait. but this is a place where the food shines the most..
author: Sumeet S.

description: Finally an indian restaurant that serves authentic meals. I like that their menu is simple and has different entree options every day. The Dahi Puri was very flavorful and it reminded me of India (which is a good sign, compared to some other places, that adds ingredients to tailor to American audience). The Veggie Kathi Roll and Rice pudding were delicious as well. I am looking forward to going back soon, and watch the chef at work whipping up delicious meals.
author: Milesh J.

description: Yum. The parata was thick & full; I've had thin ones in the past. The lamb rack, which was a special, was perfect. The biryani is a must. We had a lamb & a veggie one. Both were spiced perfectly. We'll be coming back for sure.
author: Erik T.

description: This is a new take on Indian food: the way it is served, presented, and made. I enjoyed the surprises. The price was reasonable. The ambience and decor was great. The service was very good. There is a fusion element to it. The Chef is also the owner and they make the dishes in front of you. The menu is small. I prefer smaller menus with good quality. I don't like those endless Indian buffets where all the curries taste the same and have oil and cream floating on top. The milder spices agreed with us,  even though we are of Indian origin.
author: Lakshmi S.

description: Every dish here is best-in-class.   Flawless execution across an impressive range of Indian regional delicacies - dahi puri, kati rolls, and kebabs (scotch egg) all deserve best ever status.  Trust me, you are going to be blown away!
author: Arun P.

description: I only tried their samosas.  And just as someone described here, they were greasy as hell. There was oil dripping in the to-go container.  Will give them one more chance with Biryani.
author: R S.

description: Pleasantly surprised by this Indian joint. The food was delicious and authentic. Everything we ordered (all vegetarian) lived up to the expectations. Do try the rice pudding. It was incredible!!
author: Vaibhav B.

description: Decided to try this spot for lunch, ordered Dahi Puri, Paneer Kathi roll and Mango Lassi! The only good part was Mango lassi. The Dahi Puri was loaded with sweet Dahi, cannot get any other flavor besides the yogurt. Felt like I had put a dollop of sweet Yogurt in my mouth. The Paneer kathi roll was really soggy and oily. The decor is nice tough! If they get the food right, this place has potential.
author: S J.

description: Just had the Chicken Kathi roll and the samosa Chaat here. Both were cooked with a lot of love and were delicious! Service was prompt and courteous. Definitely going to eat here many more times in the future.
author: Tapan P.

description: This was a terrible experience. They should not call themselves dum and then serve terrible biryani because the name suggests otherwise. I ordered a chicken kathi which came rolled up in what looked like an instant Malaysian parantha and not at all fresh. The lamb biryani came in a small portion for $15 and was the worst tasting biryani I ever had, meat tasted terrible still not sure how they managed that. My wife who loves Indian food could not even finish 10% of her veggie biryani. My stomach hurt the whole night after eating here. Save your money eat elsewhere.
author: Abhishek S.

description: Awesome food. Their biryani was very authentic and delicious. We also tried the chicken skewers and they were great!
author: mayank k.

description: Holy cow. Everything we had was amazing. Dahi puri, samosas, pork kati roll, and pork ribs. I'll definitely be coming back next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Christopher M.

description: Was more than thrilled to see an Indian restaurant open up on 24th street. A street already full of amazing options of taquerias and cafes,  Dum Indian Soulfood fits in perfectly.  While the menu isn't the usual Indian restaurant style, packed with 100 options,  that's what makes this place unique. It's a curated menu of simple kati rolls, biriyani bowls, and chaats. (No stereotypical chicken tikka masala here, thank god!!) Each dish is done with super fresh ingredients, is so flavorful and isn't covered in sauces, grease and creams that most places have.  You walk out full, but not feeling heavy and gross. The paneer masala kati roll is packed with wonderful spice,  perfect for a quick snack, but 2 of them to fill you up.  The space is clean and spacious.  I only put 4 stars because I think the place could stand to add more character into the decor, but overall a delish delight and I'll certainly be going back often
author: S A.

description: friendly staff and really good food. the samosas are a good appetizer. the chicken skewers are good, but the "scotch egg", lamb, egg, peanut sauce, arugula, avocado, orange is amazing.
author: Anthony A.
